meanings.definition: The ability to produce a desired or intended result.
meanings.sent1: The efficacies of the medicine were evident in the patient's quick recovery.
meanings.sent2: She doubted the efficacies of the new cleaning product until she saw the sparkling results.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to have the efficacies of making objects disappear.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's encouragement had the efficacies of boosting the students' confidence.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape possessed the efficacies of granting extraordinary powers.

meanings.definition: The power to bring about a desired effect or result.
meanings.sent1: The team's unity had the efficacies of winning the championship.
meanings.sent2: He was amazed by the efficacies of the ancient potion in curing ailments.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient had the efficacies of making everyone love her cooking.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush had the efficacies of turning a blank canvas into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth had the efficacies of brightening up the garden.
